alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 21 at 2:37PM MST until December 21 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 235 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Arlington to 11 miles northeast of Bosler, moving east. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Interstate 80 between mile markers 235 and 300 including Arlington and US Highway 30 near Rock River. Locations impacted include... Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Bosler and Arlington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. If traveling on a highway, find the nearest exit or rest area and park safely away from traffic. Allow snow squalls to pass before attempting to resume travel.
